sentences: Need on head aegade k√µik muutused need on head aegade
Need on ilusad ja head aegade
context: The word 'aegade' is the partitive plural form of 'aeg' (time) in Estonian. When combined with 'head', it forms the phrase 'head aegade' which means 'good times'. This is a common expression used to refer to periods when things are going well, pleasant moments, or favorable circumstances. The word 'aegade' specifically indicates multiple instances of time or periods.
